summary: We testified about ways DOD can improve how it buys its most expensive weapons. Programs are more likely to succeed if they start with a match between a system's needs and the technology, time, and funding available. Achieving this match—along with other knowledge at key points in the program—helps reduce the risk of cost and schedule overruns that have plagued DOD's weapon programs. DOD reformed...
title: DOD Acquisition Reform: Increased Focus on Knowledge Needed to Achieve Intended Performance and Innovation Outcomes
